author: Odd_craving
text:
Atheists aren’t all closed minded. In fact, I’ve never met an atheist wouldn’t look at or consider evidence for God. If you approach a conversation with the idea that they are impossible to talk to and closed minded, you have to ask yourself who is actually being closed minded.

I argue from the Bible for many reasons, but the biggest reason is to understand why people are so comfortable with its contents. Using examples and illustrating problems is how we learn and grow. I find the supernatural claims to be the most difficult to believe, but most of the book is difficult to believe.

I’ll explain why; About 20 years ago I became very sick. Many friends and family suggested alternative Medicine and I was interested. I began reading everything I could get my hands on and I quickly learned two things.

1) Alternative medicine is about 98% a scam. It appeals to emotions over facts. It ignores the failures and highlights the occasional (accidental) successes. It obscures data with double talk and lies. Alternative medicine is unfalsifiable - meaning any outcome can be twisted to support its claims.

2) I instantly saw an amazing and unmistakable correlation between religion and alternative medicine. Religion appeals to emotion over facts. Religion ignores the failures and celebrates those very few (and possible accidental) wins. Religion obscures data and uses double talk to get out of trouble. Religion is unfalsifiable - again, any outcome can be twisted to support its claims.

If I argue from the Bible, I may succeed in proving this.
